results.definition: the act of rotating as if on an axis
examples: the rotation of the dancer kept time with the music

results.definition: a single complete turn (axial or orbital)
examples: the plane made three rotations before it crashed

results.definition: a planned recurrent sequence (of crops or personnel etc.)
examples: crop rotation makes a balanced demand on the fertility of the soil
the manager had only four starting pitchers in his rotation

results.definition: (mathematics) a transformation in which the coordinate axes are rotated by a fixed angle about the origin
